resources.string: Check if your inputs are Anagrams
Find the STD Code of City
Print Each Word in a New Line
ENTER CITY AND SEARCH STD CODE

Hello there! Welcome to my app DeeDee's Java Projects for Students and Beginners version 1.0!

It will help if you have a basic knowledge of Java and are already familiar with basic coding to enjoy the app to the fullest.

Many a times I have noticed people and for that matter even when I began coding, of not being sure of where to start, what challenges to solve to get a hold of the basic concept and logic and what the output should look like.

So, I have listed several basic projects in a simple Android UI and you are encouraged to treat the projects as challenges and solve them on your own, on your preferred IDE for Java.

Often, logic varies from person to person and your code and logical approach may be quite different from the person next to you but the most important thing here is that you find the solution as against how it was arrived at.

Albeit that being said, the best coding policy is a short, good code with best performance.

This app is not a tutorial but much more if you may. It encourages you to think of a possible solution for the listed projects, explore available resources like your books, the internet and even discuss and compare with friends to find the solution on your own. One of the best resources on the internet is stackoverflow.com

I have included the simple Java code of the projects for your ready reference and clear understanding of the concept and make it simpler for you, but remember, your code need not be the same and the pleasure of watching your own code do its job is priceless!

Also see if you can find any errors in the code in just a glance!

This app will need to connect to the internet to display the Java code solutions as storing them locally would have increased the size of the app.

The code used in the app may have added features, you are encouraged to add the same in your code on your own.
